thread.title: Vincent Kompany misses Man City FA Cup tie with injury
thread.title_full: Vincent Kompany misses Man City FA Cup tie with injury

author: James Robson
title: Vincent Kompany misses Man City FA Cup tie with injury
text:
Vincent Kompany misses Man City FA Cup tie with injury The Manchester City captain was not included in the squad after suffering another setback Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Pep on his plan for Vincent Kompany Share this video Get Manchester City FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Vincent Kompany has suffered ANOTHER injury setback - ruling him out of Manchester City's clash with Huddersfield. 
The Belgian international, who has only just returned from knee ligament damage, missed training on Friday and was left out of Pep Guardiola's squad completely for the FA Cup fifth round tie John Smith's Stadium. 
( You can follow the match with us here .) 
It is the latest blow to the City captain, who has endured a catalogue of injuries over the past two years. 
Guardiola is due to give an update after the match, but it is believed the injury is not serious. 
His absence is thought to be more a case of City not wanting to take any risks. 
But the latest setback raises further doubts about Kompany's long-term future. 
Guardiola targeted a host of centre backs last summer, including Leonardo Bonucci and Aymeric Laporte. 
He is expected to go back into the market for a long-term partner for John Stones at the end of the season. Read More
